sen.j: 湿拓（しったく）は紙を湿らせて対象物に張り、その後墨をつけてとる拓本。
sen.e: The term "shittaku" refers to a rubbed copy made by placing wet paper on an object and then putting black ink on it.
The term "shittaku" refers to a rubbed copy made by placing wet paper on an object and then putting black ink on it.
The term "shittaku" refers to a rubbed copy made by placing wet paper on an object and then putting black ink on it.

sen.j: 本来の拓本は湿拓のみであったが、乾拓ができたため、その対比として生まれた名称である。
sen.e: Although the original method of making rubbings was only shittaku, another method called kantaku (dried rubbing) was developed later, and then this term was created in order to distinguish wet rubbings from dried rubbings.

Although the original method of making rubbings was only shittaku, another method called kantaku (dried rubbing) was developed later, and then this term was created in order to distinguish wet rubbings from dried rubbings.

Although the original method of making rubbings was only shittaku, another method called kantaku (dried rubbing) was developed later, and then this term was created in order to distinguish wet rubbings from dried rubbings.

sen.j: 間接拓と直接拓という言葉もかつては存在せず、間接的に採るのを拓本と称し、直接採るものは印刷、もしくは版画、押印と呼んだ。
sen.e: Also, people didn't use the terms "kansetsu-taku" (indirect rubbing) and "chokusetsu-taku"(direct rubbing), and the term "takuhon" (a rubbing) referred to a copy made in an indirect way, while any copies made in a direct way were called insatsu (printing), hanga (block prints), or oin (putting a seal).

Also, people didn't use the terms "kansetsu-taku" (indirect rubbing) and "chokusetsu-taku"(direct rubbing), and the term "takuhon" (a rubbing) referred to a copy made in an indirect way, while any copies made in a direct way were called insatsu (printing), hanga (block prints), or oin (putting a seal).

Also, people didn't use the terms "kansetsu-taku" (indirect rubbing) and "chokusetsu-taku"(direct rubbing), and the term "takuhon" (a rubbing) referred to a copy made in an indirect way, while any copies made in a direct way were called insatsu (printing), hanga (block prints), or oin (putting a seal).

sen.j: 魚拓は本来は魚版とか魚印と呼ばれるところ、間違って魚拓と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: The term "gyotaku" (fish rubbing) was wrongly adopted because this had been primarily called gyoban (literally, "fish printing") or gyoin (literally, "fish stamp").
The term "gyotaku" (fish rubbing) was wrongly adopted because this had been primarily called gyoban (literally, "fish printing") or gyoin (literally, "fish stamp").
The term "gyotaku" (fish rubbing) was wrongly adopted because this had been primarily called gyoban (literally, "fish printing") or gyoin (literally, "fish stamp").

sen.j: 中国では湿拓は紙を湿らせて対象物の石や金属に貼り付けるが、日本では紙を対象物に貼り付けてから、噴霧器やタオル、刷毛などで湿らせて密着させる。
sen.e: In China, paper is moistened before it is put on an object such as a stone or a metal to make a shittaku, but in Japan, paper is put on an object first, and then it is moistened with a spray, a towel, or a brush so that the paper can stick on the object.

In China, paper is moistened before it is put on an object such as a stone or a metal to make a shittaku, but in Japan, paper is put on an object first, and then it is moistened with a spray, a towel, or a brush so that the paper can stick on the object.

In China, paper is moistened before it is put on an object such as a stone or a piece of metal to make a shittaku, but in Japan, paper is first put on the object and then moistened with a water spray, a wet towel, or a wet brush so that the paper sticks to the object.

sen.j: 水をつけすぎると紙が破れるが、少ないと密着しない。
sen.e: The paper may tear if too much water is applied, but the paper will not stick on the object if the water is too little.
The paper may tear if too much water is applied, but the paper will not stick on the object if the water is too little.
The paper may tear if too much water is applied, but the paper will not stick on the object if the water is too little.

sen.j: 適度な水をしわなく貼り付けることが重要である。
sen.e: The important thing is to use a proper amount of water to stick the paper on the object without rumples.
The important thing is to use a proper amount of water to stick the paper on the object without rumples.
The important thing is to use a proper amount of water to stick the paper on the object without rumples.

sen.j: また墨をつける段階である程度乾かさないと、墨が滲んだり、薄くなったりする。
sen.e: Additionally, the paper should be somewhat dried before putting black ink; otherwise, the ink may run on the paper or become faint.
Additionally, the paper should be somewhat dried before putting black ink; otherwise, the ink may run on the paper or become faint.
Additionally, the paper should be somewhat dried before putting black ink; otherwise, the ink may run on the paper or become faint.
